name: City of Chicago - Blue Cart Residential Recycling Program
description: City of Chicago - Blue Cart Residential Recycling Program
materials: Plastic #1 (PETE); Plastic #2 (HDPE); Plastic #2 (Color HDPE); Plastic #3 (PVC); Plastic #4 (LDPE); Plastic #5 (Polypropylene); Plastic #7; Aluminum Cans; Glass (Brown); Brown Paper Bags; Cardboard; Catalogs; Glass (Clear); Computer Paper; Drink Boxes; Glass (Green); Greeting Cards; Magazines; Milk Cartons; Paper (Mixed); Newspapers; Paperboard; Phone books; Tin or Steel Cans; Office Paper
notes: The City of Chicago manages waste collection for approximately 600,000 households. In 2007, it introduced the Blue Cart Recycling program in seven communities and has since expanded it to more than 260,000 households.  In the spring of 2012, Mayor Rahm Emanuel announced all eligible households would receive the Blue Cart Recycling program by the end of 2013.
